title: Three books contain the core of Arthur Danto’s philosophy of art: The Transfiguration of the Commonplace: A Philosophy of Art

An essay by Brian Laetz, entitled ‘Kendall Walton’s “Categories of Art”: A Critical Commentary’

inspired my questions regarding the categorization of art works. Laetz argues convincingly that the notion of a correct category of appreciation, as understood by Walton, cannot be equated with the category a work belongs to, and that therefore the guidelines for discerning correct categories are different from the guidelines for determining categorymembership. Carroll refers to David Hume’s Of the Standard of Taste and also wrote an essay on it: ‘Hume's Standard of Taste’
